definition:
Let ${{\mathfrak{m}}}$ be a modulus for a number field $K$. The [*ray
class group*]{} of $K$ mod ${{\mathfrak{m}}}$ is the group
$\mathbb{I}^{{\mathfrak{m}}}/K_{{{\mathfrak{m}}},1}$, where

-   $\mathbb{I}^{{\mathfrak{m}}}$ is the subgroup of the ideal group of
    $K$ generated by all prime ideals which do not occur in the
    factorization of ${{\mathfrak{m}}}$.

-   $K_{{{\mathfrak{m}}},1}$ is the subgroup of
    $\mathbb{I}^{{\mathfrak{m}}}$ consisting of all principal ideals in
    the ring of integers of $K$ having the form $(\alpha)$ where
    $\alpha$ is multiplicatively congruent to
    $1 \bmod {{\mathfrak{m}}}$.
